From my old debate days
 
 In a Just society, the principle of equality ought to be placed above that of liberty.
 
 It is my contention that this would be false as the principles of Liberty and Equality are necessary parts of the same thing and therefore equal not one above the other. A just society is one in which the righteous are rewarded and the guilty are punished.
 
 What have you?

Obviously, everyone would like plenty of both. I guess the terms need to be defined more clearly. If I pick liberty, does that mean only certain people will get it (lack of equality)? If I pick equality, does that mean liberties are limited (equally limited to everyone)?

You are correct especially about definitions. Define your terms and produce an argument. I will do likewise. I am actually working on a more extensive post. We will let others work their definitions in.
